1. Plus $1,800 from the School of Journalism and Communications
2. Mrs. Bryner still occupies this job, technically, although chief reÂ¬
sponsibility has been shifted to Mrs. Gans (actually hired, technically
as the Engineering Service Secretary). Because of shift dtf duties,
Mrs. Bryner does not expect an increase.
3* Incumbent will be replaced July 1, at the starting rate, therefore no
increase necessary.
4. New employee, as of February 4, will begin at $3,300 and, if satisfactory,
should be increased to $3,600 as of July 1.
5. Incumbent receives only $2,400 (although $2,640 budgeted), and will be
raised to $2,640 as of July 1, thus causing increase for the individual
but not an increase in the amount budgeted for the position.
6. Labor requirements less than last year because we no longer have to pay
an outside engineer at an hourly rate to maintain the equipment.
JG
Harold E. Hill
January 30, 1957
